Frequently Asked Questions

What is the MSMS Alumni Association?

The MSMSAA is a loosely organized group of alumni of The Mississippi School for Mathematics and Science. The MSMSAA was first formed in 1994.

The first goals of the MSMSAA were to informally keep in contact with each other in the time before Facebook. This contact included updating addresses and planning alumni gatherings that were known as "Homecomings." These took place on the original campus. The school has usually had some level of involvement in the planning.

Things changed in 1997, when the MSMSAA began to try for a more independent role. The MSMSAA planned two "Homecomings," one in 1997 and one in 1998, largely without help from MSMS. There were advantages and disadvantages to this situation. The website was created in 1997, and a lot of the "Homecoming" planning took place via e-mail, among some alumni who had never met each other.

The MSMSAA Board has tried to maintain regular meetings and to formulate some short and long term goals for the MSMSAA. Short term goals have included the maintenance and additions to this website and address updates to the database.

However, it was difficult for the board to have virtual meetings, and the by-laws were never really updated to include a section for how to re-establish the organization if the organization became defunct.

Currently, the MSMSAA is working closely with The MSMS Foundation and MSMS to communicate with the alumni, send out newsletters, and organize campus events for alumni.

Who are the MSMS alumni?

The MSMS alumni are people who attended MSMS for any period of time. This includes the people who left for any reason during the two year period that it takes for students to graduate.

Who can have an account on this site?

Alumni and former MSMS faculty and staff can have accounts on this website. Current MSMS students, their parents, and grandparents are not eligible for an account on this site unless they are alumni of the school.

How do I get an account?

If you are eligible to have an account, you can click here and request one. If you do not receive a response within a week, complain on the MSMSAlumni Facebook group.

What should I do after I get my account?

Change your password to something that you can remember. Then update your address in the database.

What is available on this website ?

On the public site, there are newsletters and photos.

On the private site, there is a database of alumni contact information and some related search features like the zipcode proximity search that helps you find the alumni that are closest to your zipcode.

How is the information in the database used?

The database is used to help other alumni find you. It is occasionally shared with MSMS and the MSMS Foundation. Occasionally, alumni will use the database to email a class and share relevant information.

The data here is never shared with other parties than the ones listed above.

What do I do if I have forgotten my password?

If you have the same email address as the last time you updated this account, simply click here. Otherwise, email webmaster@msmsaa.org.

Why are there two address fields in the database?

The database contains a permanent address and a current address field. The permanent address acts as a back up address for alumni who move frequently. The addresses of the parents of new graduates are typically placed in the permanent field.

Where can I send updated contact information for alumni that I know?

Fill out the linked form.

We ask that you contact the people first so that they can keep their information accurate. However, we will update information if necessary for an event.
